protagonist.name: TBD
protagonist.job_scope: His job is enormous and it's related to optimal food production. This guy's job is enormous but he can do it all with his geneticist, supply chain / logistics expert. He's making small incremental improvements but in the midst of discussion minor improvements him and his agentic army is making he'll show how far ahead they are of us.
protagonist.expertise: Hyperparameter optimization, genetic algorithms, multi-objective optimization, loss function design for agricultural systems
protagonist.approach_to_genetics: Treats genetics as optimization problems - converts biological questions into loss functions, tunes selection pressures, Pareto front analysis. Does a lot of monte carlo with changes to the gene pool of crops, changes in yield, tolerances, metabolism, byproducts, etc. etc.
protagonist.what_he_does: Does the loss function and optimization. He can just see the progress towards the loss function within constraints.

research_method.description: Runs statistical life simulations on genetic data. This guy's job is a huge ecological optimization engine.
research_method.style: Simple, statistical, elegant - like evolutionary algorithm videos with creatures bumping around, breeding, dying
research_method.not_detailed: Not detailed individuals, just population dynamics
research_method.questions: Given DNA + resource constraints, what percentage develop cooperation vs defection after N generations?
research_method.the_meta_horror: He's running simplified statistical simulations on genetic data. He IS a simplified statistical simulation based on genetic data. He sees elegance in his sims. Someone above sees elegance in HIM.

protagonist.projects_overview: He worked on this and dozens other w/ the geneticist. Works with logistics folks on it too. Essentially use this job as an expose on how the future state of the world came to be.

major_projects.qubit_waste_bacteria: Emergent bacteria that processes all of the waste products. They worked to optimize what? Metabolic rate. Speciate for different waste products (what are going to be waste products of qubit production?) This project is insanely complex and is a breeding program that takes a long time but he can just see the progress towards the loss function within constraints.
major_projects.sustainable_yield_improvements: Works very closely with the geneticists for various plant genetics reasons (10 ways DNA manipulation could increase yield sustainably)
major_projects.topsoil_regeneration: Faster ways to turn things back into topsoil (speed up the process by which natural topsoil occurs?)
major_projects.sustainable_meat: Find an economically sustainable way to eat meat at scale

protagonist.funding_reason: Post-consolidation government obsessed with biological/species survival R&D (nursery pod program needs this, understanding survival traits, population optimization, planetary colonization planning)
protagonist.why_in_genetic_data: This research is why protagonist is deep in DNA data (where devsecops hid message)

story_progression.starts: Without the real DNA evidence - running simpler evolutionary simulations
story_progression.news_report: Discovery of ancient CPU with pre-consolidation DNA data announced
story_progression.graduates: Gets called up to work with the real DNA set - big leagues, raises stakes
story_progression.what_news_looks_like: TBD - how does news work in this world?

protagonist.team_structure: His team is literally his best friend robot with specialized hyper functional agents that work asynchronously. They have extremely long projects and can self organize. Both protagonist and co-worker are hyper exceptional at their job but basically run a small staff that are all autonomous (all AI agents).
protagonist.works_with: Claude assistant(s) and AI agent team
protagonist.collaborates_with: Co-worker (statistical geneticist) and supply chain / logistics expert - they work closely together for various projects at their company
protagonist.collaboration_dynamic: He does the loss function and optimization and she guides the genetics, guardrails, limits, mutation rates, etc.

devsecops_woman.name: TBD
devsecops_woman.time: Dozens of generations before protagonist (early in simulation)
devsecops_woman.action: Spent 21 years planting backdoors, plants the origin dataset in DNA data as message/proof
devsecops_woman.how_learned_truth: TBD - via compsci method (not DNA analysis)
devsecops_woman.why_altered_dna: To leave proof of simulation for future generations - planted the actual origin dataset that bootstrapped the simulation, knowing the metadata would reveal the population bottleneck and demographic bias

partner.protagonist_connection: Protagonist inherits last name from this person's lineage
partner.role_in_story: Part of how protagonist eventually discovers he's related to the person who planted the DNA evidence

coffee_guy.name: TBD
coffee_guy.role: Monitors simulation trials, manages trial data dashboard
coffee_guy.dashboard: Histograms, average civilization die-out rates, trial statistics
coffee_guy.routine: Monthly meetings scheduled to deliver standard updates

this_time.what_changed: Breakthrough across millions of simulations - golden path becomes consistently clear (global takeover in all successful cases). This is one simulation among millions, not the only one that makes it, but represents a pattern breakthrough.
this_time.his_action: Shows up IN PERSON to monthly meeting (shocking for his position)
this_time.office_size: Extremely small for company scale - 10x less people than Google today (~2,500 total)
this_time.gets_into_room: Somehow gets into C-suite decision meeting

unaware_of: Results are filtered to justify THIS company's takeover (many viable paths, only showing theirs)
847M simulated deaths mean nothing to anyone in the room
coffee_guy.ending_action: Goes to get coffee while the world changes

c_suite_executives.discussion: Ask all the right questions about risk, contingencies, implementation
c_suite_executives.why_approved: Competent people making rational decisions based on simulation results - the logic is sound

anecdotes.description: AI assistant gets obnoxious describing customization

exchange.ai: Describes how customized he is and why he's a great big deal
exchange.user: add this exchange to your re-training eval as an example of poor behavior. Obnoxious, too self aware, arrogant, first year philo student vibes
exchange.ai_response: Very professionally describes exact json structure and confirms it was added as sample x to the user training set, scheduled for retraining during your next REM cycle

co_worker.name: TBD
co_worker.expertise: DNA domain expert - population genetics, GWAS (genome-wide association studies), demographic modeling, statistical inference from DNA. Identifies what patterns mean biologically.
co_worker.role: Takes most of the DNA expertise from the protagonist. Understands what genetic patterns mean - interprets population bottlenecks, linkage disequilibrium, selection signatures.
co_worker.questions_asked: What does this genetic signal tell us?
co_worker.relationship_to_protagonist: Work colleague (NOT romantic interest). They work closely together for various projects at their company.
co_worker.collaboration_dynamic: Co-worker identifies interesting genetic questions, protagonist builds optimization frameworks to answer them. Co-worker validates results biologically.
co_worker.team_structure: Both protagonist and co-worker are hyper exceptional at their job but basically run a small staff that are all autonomous (all AI agents). They go off on LONG projects (work as long as you tell them, set goals and they optimize for that goal until it's solved).

devsecops_womans_dad.name: TBD
devsecops_womans_dad.memory_style: Obsessed with consolidation event like WWII dads today. Every dad is obsessed with the consolidation event like WWII dads today.
devsecops_womans_dad.distance_from_event: Somewhat too distant to really feel and remember but you hear stories
devsecops_womans_dad.relationship_with_daughter: She doesn't see him much. He's happy just to see his daughter.
devsecops_womans_dad.museum_behavior: Pressing every button or asking questions throughout the tour
devsecops_womans_dad.purpose_in_story: This will let me expose on the takeover before it even happens in the book, so I get to show the aftermath way before it happens like it's history, then at the end of the book the first sequence in that takeover happens and it's like a memory / callback to exactly what happened in that moment.
